archived.name: Background Service Worker
archived.description: Implement a background service worker for the browser extension to handle background processing, event handling, and persistent functionality even when the popup is closed.
verification: Background service worker file created in entrypoints/background.ts
Service worker registers successfully on extension load
Event listeners properly configured (runtime.onInstalled, runtime.onMessage, etc.)
Background worker can communicate with popup and content scripts
TypeScript types are correct with no compilation errors
Service worker persists and handles events when popup is closed
Build succeeds with no errors: npm run build
Extension loads in browser without errors

archived.name: Auto-Launch Browser in Development
archived.description: Configure WXT to automatically open the browser with the extension installed during development. Enables seamless development workflow by launching Chrome/Firefox with the extension pre-loaded when running npm run dev.
verification: wxt.config.ts updated with browser startup configuration
npm run dev automatically opens Chrome with extension installed
npm run dev:firefox automatically opens Firefox with extension installed
Extension loads without errors in auto-launched browser
Browser can be configured to open/not open via config
TypeScript compilation passes with no errors
Build succeeds with no errors

archived.name: StreamFilter Request/Response Capture with UI
archived.description: Use Firefox's StreamFilter API to capture HTTP requests and responses matching URL patterns defined in a configuration. This feature will intercept both regular requests and XHR calls, store captured data in memory, and provide a UI to view the captured information.
verification: StreamFilter API integrated in background script
URL pattern configuration system implemented
Regular HTTP requests captured successfully
XHR requests captured successfully
Request headers, body, and metadata stored
Response headers, body, and status stored
In-memory storage working correctly
UI displays list of captured requests
UI shows detailed request/response information
Pattern matching filters work correctly
TypeScript compilation passes with no errors
Extension builds successfully for Firefox
Extension loads and functions in Firefox without errors

archived.name: Popup Interface Can Open in Tab
archived.description: Allow the popup interface to open in a separate browser tab, providing users with a full-page view of the extension UI instead of being confined to the small popup window.
verification: Browser action configured to support opening in tab
UI can be opened as a standalone page (chrome-extension:// or moz-extension:// URL)
Option/button added to open popup in new tab
Tab view uses same Vue components as popup
Tab view displays correctly with responsive layout
All functionality works in tab mode (same as popup)
TypeScript compilation passes with no errors
Extension builds successfully for Firefox
Extension loads and functions in Firefox without errors
User can switch between popup and tab views seamlessly
